de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class WizardDialog.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<WizardDialog,WizardDialog.Builder>
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.WizardDialog.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    WizardDialog

    public static class WizardDialog.Builder
extends AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<WizardDialog,WizardDialog.Builder>
    A builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.
      Builder(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               android.content.Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

        public final WizardDialog.Builder addFragment(@NonNull
                                              java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass,
                                              @Nullable
                                              android.os.Bundle arguments)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog, which is created by the builder.
        Parameters:
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        arguments - A bundle, which should be passed to the fragment, when it is shown, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no arguments should be passed to the fragment

        public final WizardDialog.Builder setTabPosition(@NonNull
                                                 WizardDialog.TabPosition tabPosition)
        Sets the position of the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - The position, which should be set, as a value of the enum WizardDialog.TabPosition. The position may either be USE_HEADER, PREFER_HEADER or NO_HEADER
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class WizardDialog.Builder

      • enableTabLayout

        public final WizardDialog.Builder enableTabLayout(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment. When the tabs are enabled, it is possible to switch between the fragments by clicking the tabs.
        Parameters:
        enable - True, if the tabs should be enabled, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class WizardDialog.Builder

      • addWizardListener

        public final WizardDialog.Builder addWizardListener(@NonNull
                                                    WizardDialog.WizardListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the user navigates within the dialog, which is created by the builder. Note, that the attached listeners are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type WizardDialog.WizardListener. The listener may not be null
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class WizardDialog.Builder

      • addOnPageChangeListener

        public final WizardDialog.Builder addOnPageChangeListener(@NonNull
                                                          android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener listener)
        Adds a listener, which should be notified, when the page of the view page of the dialog, which is created by the builder, has been changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener. The listener may not be null
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class WizardDialog.Builder

      • show

        public final WizardDialog show(@NonNull
                               android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String tag)
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder and immediately displays it.
        Parameters:
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class FragmentManager. The fragment manager may not be null
        tag - The tag, which should be used to show the dialog, as a String or null, if no tag should be used
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been shown, as an instance of the class WizardDialog

      • show

        public final WizardDialog show(@NonNull
                               android.support.v4.app.FragmentTransaction fragmentTransaction,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String tag)
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder and immediately displays it.
        Parameters:
        fragmentTransaction - The fragment transaction, which should be used to show the dialog, as an instance of the class FragmentTransaction. The fragment transaction may not be null
        tag - The tag, which should be used to show the dialog, as a String or null, if no tag should be used
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been shown, as an instance of the class WizardDialog
